content.question: A survey question asks respondents to rate, on a scale of 1 to 10, how much their actions correspond with their attitudes. How might the language of this survey question influence the outcomes of a correlational study on cognitive dissonance?

choices.label: Language emphasizing the link between actions and attitudes may introduce self-report bias.
Emotionally charged language may enhance response authenticity.
Language focusing on participants' dissonance may reduce social desirability bias.
Ambiguous language increases the likelihood of accurate self-reporting.

content.answer: Language emphasizing the link between actions and attitudes may introduce self-report bias.

skill.text: 2.C: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in non-experimental methodologies.
